DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Umbilical Cord Blood Repository Recipient Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to a cord blood bank recipient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Umbilical Cord Blood Repository
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._A facility where things can be deposited for storage or safekeeping.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Umbilical Cord Blood
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: A facility where things can be deposited for storage or safekeeping.

Concepts.definition: A facility where items can be deposited for storage or safekeeping.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
